intro: Notoseris yakoensis, commonly known as Yako goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Yako in the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Notoseris yakoensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
